definition:
A *Dirac sequence* is a sequence $(\delta_k)$ of functions $\delta_k$,
which satisfies the following conditions:

1.  $\delta_k\geq0$ for all $k$.\

2.  $\int_{-\infty}^\infty\delta_k(t)dt=1$ for all $k$.\

3.  For every $r>0$ and $\varepsilon>0$ there is an $N\in\mathbb{N}$,
    such that for all $k>N$ we have
    $$\int_{\mathbb{R}\backslash[-r,r]}\delta_k(t)dt<\varepsilon.$$

These functions “converge” to the Dirac delta function.
